name: Samaritans of Thailand
description: A non-profit organization providing anonymous, confidential emotional support for those feeling depressed, lonely, or suicidal. The English line is a callback service within 24 hours.

name: Department of Mental Health Hotline (1323)
description: The official government mental health hotline providing free, 24/7 consultation for stress, depression, and mental health issues.

name: Social Assistance Center (1300)
description: Operated by the Ministry of Social Development and Human Security, this hotline helps with domestic violence, human trafficking, and child protection issues.

name: Depress We Care
description: A specialized service by the Police General Hospital providing support for depression and mental health issues for police officers and the general public.

name: Childline Thailand
description: A dedicated hotline for children and youth under 18 to discuss family problems, abuse, or mental health concerns safely and confidentially.

name: Manarom Hospital Crisis Center
description: A private specialized mental health hospital offering comprehensive psychiatric care and emergency services.

name: Sati App
description: An on-demand listening service app that connects users with trained empathetic listeners for anonymous emotional support.

name: Medical Emergency Hotline (1669)
description: The national emergency number for ambulance and medical rescue services in life-threatening situations.

name: Bumrungrad Behavioral Health Center
description: A premium medical center providing holistic mental health care, counselling, and psychiatric treatment for adults and children.

name: Bangkok Counselling Service
description: Provides psychological counseling and psychotherapy for individuals, couples, and families, specializing in the expat community.
